Package chess_game

Class Pawn

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess_game.Piece
      • chess_game.Pawn
  • public class Pawn
extends Piece
    There are initially 8 Pawns per team, forming the front line of the team. A Pawn can only advance linearly forward normally. Pawns are unique in their abilities to capture in a different manner than their standard movement, to promote, and to move farther on their initial move. Pawns capture by moving diagonally forward and to the side one square. They can promote to a greater piece if the pawn reaches the farthest row of the board (the enemy's first rank).

    • Method Detail

      • promote

        public Piece promote()
        Replaces the current pawn with a higher ranked piece.
        Returns:
        a newly created Piece of higher value than Pawn. Cannot return King.

      • twoSquareAdvance

        public void twoSquareAdvance​(Pair destination)
        Requires hasMoved to be False. Pawn advances two tiles instead of 1. Cannot capture, must not be obstructed in any way, and puts pawn at risk of en passant capture for the next turn only. Changes hasMoved to True.
        Parameters:
        destination - the space the pawn is moving to.
